finding.title: Check if EBS Default Encryption is activated.
finding.desc: Check if EBS Default Encryption is activated.

supporting_data.Risk: If not enabled sensitive information at rest is not protected.

remediation.desc: Enable Encryption. Use a CMK where possible. It will provide additional management and privacy benefits.

status_detail: EBS Default Encryption is not activated.

compliance.status_detail: EBS Default Encryption is not activated.

message: EBS Default Encryption is not activated.

finding.title: Ensure there are no EBS Volumes unencrypted.
finding.desc: Ensure there are no EBS Volumes unencrypted.

supporting_data.Risk: Data encryption at rest prevents data visibility in the event of its unauthorized access or theft.

remediation.desc: Encrypt all EBS volumes and Enable Encryption by default You can configure your AWS account to enforce the encryption of the new EBS volumes and snapshot copies that you create. For example; Amazon EBS encrypts the EBS volumes created when you launch an instance and the snapshots that you copy from an unencrypted snapshot.

status_detail: EBS Snapshot vol-0315a657b59b02937 is unencrypted.

compliance.status_detail: EBS Snapshot vol-0315a657b59b02937 is unencrypted.

message: EBS Snapshot vol-0315a657b59b02937 is unencrypted.

finding.title: Check if EBS snapshots exists.
finding.desc: Check if EBS snapshots exists.

supporting_data.Risk: Ensure that your EBS volumes (available or in-use) have recent snapshots (taken weekly) available for point-in-time recovery for a better, more reliable data backup strategy.

remediation.desc: Creating point-in-time EBS snapshots periodically will allow you to handle efficiently your data recovery process in the event of a failure, to save your data before shutting down an EC2 instance, to back up data for geographical expansion and to maintain your disaster recovery stack up to date.

status_detail: Snapshots not found for the EBS volume vol-0315a657b59b02937.

compliance.status_detail: Snapshots not found for the EBS volume vol-0315a657b59b02937.

message: Snapshots not found for the EBS volume vol-0315a657b59b02937.

finding.title: Check if there is any unassigned Elastic IP.
finding.desc: Check if there is any unassigned Elastic IP.

supporting_data.Risk: Unassigned Elastic IPs may result in extra cost.

remediation.desc: Ensure Elastic IPs are not unassigned.

status_detail: Elastic IP 3.0.204.89 is associated with an instance or network interface.

compliance.status_detail: Elastic IP 3.0.204.89 is associated with an instance or network interface.

message: Elastic IP 3.0.204.89 is associated with an instance or network interface.

finding.title: Check if EC2 instances have detailed monitoring enabled.
finding.desc: Check if EC2 instances have detailed monitoring enabled.

supporting_data.Risk: Enabling detailed monitoring provides enhanced monitoring and granular insights into EC2 instance metrics. Not having detailed monitoring enabled may limit the ability to troubleshoot performance issues effectively.

remediation.desc: Enable detailed monitoring for EC2 instances to gain better insights into performance metrics.

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 does not have detailed monitoring enabled.

compliance.status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 does not have detailed monitoring enabled.

message: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 does not have detailed monitoring enabled.

finding.title: Check if EC2 Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2) is Enabled and Required.
finding.desc: Check if EC2 Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2) is Enabled and Required.

supporting_data.Risk: Using IMDSv2 will protect from misconfiguration and SSRF vulnerabilities. IMDSv1 will not.

remediation.desc: If you don't need IMDS you can turn it off. Using aws-cli you can force the instance to use only IMDSv2.

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 has IMDSv2 enabled and required.

requirements: NIST-CSF-1.1: cm_2, cm_5, cp_4, cp_5, ra_5, sc_4
FedRamp-Moderate-Revision-4: ac-3, ac-6, ca-7-a-b, si-4-2, si-4-4, si-4-5, si-4-a-b-c
compliance.status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 has IMDSv2 enabled and required.

message: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 has IMDSv2 enabled and required.

finding.title: Check for internet facing EC2 instances with Instance Profiles attached.
finding.desc: Check for internet facing EC2 instances with Instance Profiles attached.

supporting_data.Risk: Exposing an EC2 directly to internet increases the attack surface and therefore the risk of compromise.

remediation.desc: Use an ALB and apply WAF ACL.

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 at IP 3.0.204.89 is internet-facing with Instance Profile arn:aws:iam::850960379897:instance-profile/ec2-ssm-instance-profile.

compliance.status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 at IP 3.0.204.89 is internet-facing with Instance Profile arn:aws:iam::850960379897:instance-profile/ec2-ssm-instance-profile.

message: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 at IP 3.0.204.89 is internet-facing with Instance Profile arn:aws:iam::850960379897:instance-profile/ec2-ssm-instance-profile.

finding.title: Check if EC2 instances are managed by Systems Manager.
finding.desc: Check if EC2 instances are managed by Systems Manager.

supporting_data.Risk: AWS Config provides AWS Managed Rules, which are predefined, customizable rules that AWS Config uses to evaluate whether your AWS resource configurations comply with common best practices.

remediation.desc: Verify and apply Systems Manager Prerequisites.

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 is managed by Systems Manager.

requirements: ENS-RD2022: op.acc.4.aws.iam.6, op.acc.4.aws.sys.1, op.exp.1.aws.sys.1, op.exp.4.aws.sys.2, op.exp.4.r2.aws.sys.1, op.exp.9.aws.img.1
NIST-CSF-1.1: am_1, am_2, ds_3, ds_7, ds_8, ip_1, ip_2, ip_12
FedRamp-Moderate-Revision-4: cm-2, cm-7-a, cm-8-1, cm-8-3-a, sa-3-a, sa-10, si-2-2, si-7-1
compliance.status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 is managed by Systems Manager.

message: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 is managed by Systems Manager.

finding.title: Check EC2 Instances older than specific days.
finding.desc: Check EC2 Instances older than specific days.

supporting_data.Risk: Having old instances within your AWS account could increase the risk of having vulnerable software.

remediation.desc: Check if software running in the instance is up to date and patched accordingly. Use AWS Systems Manager to patch instances and view patching compliance information.

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 is not older than 180 days (0 days).

compliance.status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 is not older than 180 days (0 days).

message: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 is not older than 180 days (0 days).

finding.title: Ensure IAM instance roles are used for AWS resource access from instances
finding.desc: Ensure IAM instance roles are used for AWS resource access from instances.

supporting_data.Risk: AWS access from within AWS instances can be done by either encoding AWS keys into AWS API calls or by assigning the instance to a role which has an appropriate permissions policy for the required access. AWS IAM roles reduce the risks associated with sharing and rotating credentials that can be used outside of AWS itself. If credentials are compromised, they can be used from outside of the AWS account.

remediation.desc: Create an IAM instance role if necessary and attach it to the corresponding EC2 instance..

types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 associated with Instance Profile Role arn:aws:iam::850960379897:instance-profile/ec2-ssm-instance-profile.

compliance.status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 associated with Instance Profile Role arn:aws:iam::850960379897:instance-profile/ec2-ssm-instance-profile.

message: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 associated with Instance Profile Role arn:aws:iam::850960379897:instance-profile/ec2-ssm-instance-profile.

finding.desc: Check for EC2 Instances with Public IP.

supporting_data.Risk: Exposing an EC2 directly to internet increases the attack surface and therefore the risk of compromise.

remediation.desc: Use an ALB and apply WAF ACL.

status_detail: EC2 Instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 has a Public IP: 3.0.204.89 ().

requirements: NIST-800-53-Revision-4: ac_4, ac_6, ac_21, sc_7_3, sc_7
FedRamp-Moderate-Revision-4: ac-3, ac-4, ac-6, ac-17-1, ac-21-b, cm-2, sc-7-3, sc-7

finding.title: Find secrets in EC2 User Data.
finding.desc: Find secrets in EC2 User Data.

supporting_data.Risk: Secrets hardcoded into instance user data can be used by malware and bad actors to gain lateral access to other services.

remediation.desc: Implement automated detective control (e.g. using tools like Prowler) to scan accounts for passwords and secrets. Use secrets manager service to store and retrieve passwords and secrets.

status_detail: No secrets found in EC2 instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 since User Data is empty.

compliance.status_detail: No secrets found in EC2 instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 since User Data is empty.

message: No secrets found in EC2 instance i-00a3ae5c672f62596 since User Data is empty.

finding.title: Ensure no Network ACLs allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to any port.
finding.desc: Ensure no Network ACLs allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to any port.

supporting_data.Risk: Even having a perimeter firewall, having network acls open allows any user or malware with vpc access to scan for well known and sensitive ports and gain access to instance.

remediation.desc: Apply Zero Trust approach. Implement a process to scan and remediate unrestricted or overly permissive network acls. Recommended best practices is to narrow the definition for the minimum ports required.

status_detail: Network ACL acl-0607a8ae41e75fc27 has every port open to the Internet.

requirements: FFIEC: d3-pc-am-b-10, d3-pc-im-b-1, d3-pc-im-b-2, d3-pc-im-b-6, d4-c-co-b-2
FedRamp-Moderate-Revision-4: ac-4, ac-17-1, ac-21-b, cm-2, sc-4, sc-7-3, sc-7

finding.title: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to any port.
finding.desc: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 to any port.

supporting_data.Risk: If Security groups are not properly configured the attack surface is increased.

remediation.desc: Use a Zero Trust approach. Narrow ingress traffic as much as possible. Consider north-south as well as east-west traffic.

finding.title: Ensure the default security group of every VPC restricts all traffic.
finding.desc: Ensure the default security group of every VPC restricts all traffic.

supporting_data.Risk: Even having a perimeter firewall, having security groups open allows any user or malware with vpc access to scan for well known and sensitive ports and gain access to instance.

remediation.desc: Apply Zero Trust approach. Implement a process to scan and remediate unrestricted or overly permissive security groups. Recommended best practices is to narrow the definition for the minimum ports required.

status_detail: Default Security Group (sg-0c5fc65165567f9fc) rules do not allow traffic.

requirements: FedRamp-Moderate-Revision-4: ac-4, ac-17-1, ac-21-b, cm-2, sc-4, sc-7-3, sc-7
compliance.status_detail: Default Security Group (sg-0c5fc65165567f9fc) rules do not allow traffic.

message: Default Security Group (sg-0c5fc65165567f9fc) rules do not allow traffic.

finding.title: Security Groups created by EC2 Launch Wizard.
finding.desc: Security Groups created by EC2 Launch Wizard.

supporting_data.Risk: Security Groups Created on the AWS Console using the EC2 wizard may allow port 22 from 0.0.0.0/0.

remediation.desc: Apply Zero Trust approach. Implement a process to scan and remediate security groups created by the EC2 Wizard. Recommended best practices is to use an authorized security group.

status_detail: Security group default (sg-0c5fc65165567f9fc) was not created using the EC2 Launch Wizard.

finding.title: Ensure VPC Flow Logging is Enabled in all VPCs.
finding.desc: Ensure VPC Flow Logging is Enabled in all VPCs.

supporting_data.Risk: VPC Flow Logs provide visibility into network traffic that traverses the VPC and can be used to detect anomalous traffic or insight during security workflows.

remediation.desc: It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet Rejects for VPCs.

status_detail: VPC VPC Main Flow logs are disabled.

finding.title: Ensure VPC subnets do not assign public IP by default
finding.desc: Ensure VPC subnets do not assign public IP by default

supporting_data.Risk: VPC subnet is a part of the VPC having its own rules for traffic. Assigning the Public IP to the subnet automatically (on launch) can accidentally expose the instances within this subnet to internet and should be edited to 'No' post creation of the Subnet.

remediation.desc: VPC subnets should not allow automatic public IP assignment

status_detail: VPC subnet Subnet Public Main does NOT assign public IP by default.

compliance.status_detail: VPC subnet Subnet Public Main does NOT assign public IP by default.

message: VPC subnet Subnet Public Main does NOT assign public IP by default.
